page.title: 13Tourism
page.content: Tourism is second in importance to agriculture in Northumberland and vital to maintaining the areas economy The two main enterprises are farmhouse holidays and camping. Farmhouse holidays at Lumbylaw farm cater for 6 to 12 persons staying on a weekly basis at a charge of #14 per person per night. There is a high demand for this accommodation between May and October, with almost 100% occupancy rate achieved. The majority of visitors come from the south of England and many return annually. They enjoy the openess of the countryside, the beautiful beaches and well preserved historic houses and castles.
